Quotes.q: The nature of Christ's salvation is woefully misrepresented by the present-day “evangelist.” He announces a Savior from hell rather than the Savior from sin. And that is why so many are faithfully deceived, for there are multitudes who wish to escape the lake of fire, who have no desire to be delivered from their carnality and worldliness.
The Bible was written in tears, and to tears it yields its best treasures.
The Devil is a better theologian than any of use and is a devil still. - A.W. Tozer

We have a lot of hero worship in the Church of Christ today. We are magnifying the messenger and consequently minimizing the message. The message should be of such a nature that it overshadows the messenger.
A scared world needs a fearless church.
He who begins by seeking God within himself may end by confusing himself with God.
There are no dark corners of the universe that God's all seeing eye cannot pierce; there is nothing that occurs in it which is hidden from his universal glance.
God can use a sensitive Christian to be a rich blessing in the life of one who knows the pain and sorrow.
God has given us two hands, one to receive with and the other to give with.

There are, in fact, no historical data that prevent one from acquiescing in the conviction held by the universal church that, despite the very human factors... in the production, preservation, and collection of the books of the New Testament, the whole process can also be rightly characterized as the result of divine overruling.
You have never truly found Jesus if you do not tell others about Him.
Atheism is a strange thing. Even the devils never fell into that vice.
Revivals, if genuine, don't always come the moment you whistle for them.
The important thing to remember is repentance is the prelude to revival. The Church must first repent.
So live for the kingdom of God. Seek to bring glory to Jesus Christ and the Lord will use you. It is my prayer, my constant and daily prayer, that God would keep me useable.
For those who have given up much to Christ, there are great, great rewards ahead.

Anyone who has ever been told by a friend that the Lord led such a friend to do something completely silly, or anyone who has ever been at a Bible study where the burden has been to explain “what the text means to me,” regardless of what the words on the page and the grammar and syntax might otherwise indicate, has experienced an evangelical mysticism that is not really distinguishable from traditional liberalism at the level of its understanding of what constitutes truth.
Free will, though it makes evil possible, is also the only thing that makes possible any love or goodness or joy worth having.
The Gospel spread to the know world during the first century WITHOUT radio, television, or the printing press, because these produced men who were reproducing.
The pursuit of purity is not about the suppression of lust, but about the reorientation of one's life to a larger goal.
Pray often, for prayer is a shield to the soul, a sacrifice to God, and a scourge for Satan.
When God wants to judge a nation, He gives them wicked rulers.
The true Gospel is a call to self-denial. It is not a call to self-fulfillment.
When people ask me what appeals to me about heaven, it isn't the streets of transparent gold or gates made of pearls; it's the absence of sin. I'm tired of sin.
We should not be entertained by the sins for which Christ died.
The Church is supposed to go out and change the world. Instead, the world has come in and changed the Church.

Do we go to God’s house expecting something to happen? Or do we go just to listen to a sermon, and to sing our hymns, and to meet with one another? How often does this vital idea enter into our minds that we are in the presence of the living God, that the Holy Spirit is in the church, that we may feel the touch of his power? How much do we think in terms of coming together to meet with God, and to worship him, and to stand before him, and to listen to him? Is there not this appalling danger that we are just content because we have correct beliefs? And we have lost the life, the vital thing, the power, the thing that really makes worship worship, which is in Spirit and truth.

Unless I am convinced by proofs of Scriptures or by plain and clear arguments, I can and will not retract, for it is neither safe nor qwise to do anything against my conscience. Here I stand, I can do no other. God, help me. Amen.
Extraordinary afflictions are NOT always the punishment of extraordinary sins, but sometimes the trial of extraordinary graces.

So completely was Jesus bent upon saving sinners by the sacrifice of Himself, He creates the tree upon which He was to die, and nurtured from infancy the men who were to nail Him to the accursed wood.
The center of salvation is the cross of Jesus, and the reason it is so easy to obtain salvation is because it cost God so much.

If I want to identify fully with Jesus Christ who I claim to be my Savior and Lord then the best way I can do that is to identify with the poor. Christianity is not about building an absolutely secure little niche in this world where you can live with your perfect little wife and your perfect little children in a beautiful little house, where you have no gays or minority groups anywhere near you. Christianity is about learning to love like Jesus loved and Jesus loved the poor and Jesus loved the broken.
We must never exchange the truth for followers, sound doctrine for likes, and the message of the Cross for a message of comfort.

It is misleading to say that God accepts us the way we are. Rather he accepts us despite the way we are. He receives us only in Christ and for Christ's sake. Nor does he mean to leave us the way he found us, but to transform us into the likeness of His Son.
Contextually, John 3:16 is asserting a relatively unusual notion that God not only loves those who follow him but he actually loves the entire world.
